questions.text: Eggshell calcification is seen in all the following, except?

A 32-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department an hour after developing acute-onset, right upper quadrant abdominal pain followed by syncope. She has no chronic medical conditions. She uses combined oral contraceptives. Temperature is 38.1 C (100.6 F), blood pressure is 80/50 mm Hg, pulse is 120/min, and respirations are 20/min. Oxygen saturation is 95% on room air. The patient appears anxious and pale. Examination shows abdominal distention, diffuse abdominal tenderness, and tender hepatomegaly. Laboratory results are as follows: Hemoglobin 9.1 g/dL Platelets 180,000/dl Leukocytes 8200/dl Abdominal ultrasound of the right upper quadrant shows a solid liver mass and free fluid in the abdomen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most likely diagnosis according to the given image?
questions.correct_answer: B. Pseudoaneurysm of internal carotid artery
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Pseudoaneurysm of internal carotid artery

questions.text: A 60 year old female underwent hip repalcement. After 1 year she developed fever and pain in the joint. Radiograph revealed looseding of prosthesis. The implant had to be removed. The histological image of the tissue adjoining the implant is show below. What is the diagnosis?

A young man, aged 25, arrived with complaints of being unable to bend the distal interphalangeal joint of his 4th and 5th fingers. Additionally, he faced difficulty in gripping a piece of paper between his fingers. Where is the probable location of the injury?

A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after falling approximately 3m from a ladder, landing on his left side. There was no loss of consciousness. The patient has left shoulder and left-sided chest pain, as well as abdominal pain. Blood pressure is 114/72 mm Hg and pulse is 116/min. Physical examination shows bruising to the left side of the chest wall and abdomen. There is sharp, left-sided chest pain with deep inspiration but equal breath sounds on both sides. The left costal margin and the left upper quadrant of the abdomen are tender to palpation. Range of motion of the left shoulder is normal. eFAST is shown below. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Obtain CT scan of the abdomen

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain dedicated radiographs of the ribs

options.label: D
options.text: Obtain plain radiographs of the left shoulder

questions.correct_answer: B. Obtain CT scan of the abdomen
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Obtain CT scan of the abdomen

questions.text: Identify the likely diagnosis in the image shown below:
Following head trauma, patient opens eyes to pain, localize pain on right and but withdraws on left side, and speaks incoherent words. His GCS is:

A 56-year-old woman comes to the OPD with skin lesions on her right arm that she noticed 3 weeks ago. She underwent a right mastectomy for advanced breast cancer 7 years ago and was treated with radiation and chemotherapy. Since her treatment, the patient has had swelling of the right arm. Her mother was recently diagnosed with shingles. Physical examination shows nonpitting edema of the right upper extremity. There are 3 firm purple papules on the inner surface of the right arm. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

A 45-year-old man with a history of peptic ulcer disease presents to the emergency department with acute abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. He reports a recent history of non-compliance with his prescribed proton pump inhibitor medication. On examination, he appears pale and has a rigid abdomen with rebound tenderness. CXR of the patient is shown in the image below. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Admit the patient to the ward and observe

questions.text: A 16-year-old girl arrives with several swellings and numerous brown rashes. Bone scans reveal heightened activity in the femur, skull, and rib areas. There are irregularities in her biochemical values. Additionally, she has a past medical record of hypothyroidism. The provided image displays an X-ray of her femur. What is the probable diagnosis from the options provided?

A 55-year-old man undergoes a Whipple procedure for suspected pancreatic adenocarcinoma of the head of the pancreas. Prior to the procedure, the patient receives a dose of prophylactic antibiotics. Toward the end of the operation, he is given 2 units of packed red blood cells. The patient is then extubated and transferred to the postanesthesia care unit for recovery. One hour later, he develops fever and chills. Temperature is 38.5 C (101.3 F), blood pressure is 130/76 mm Hg, pulse is 90/min, and respirations are 16/min. Examination shows a mildly tender abdominal wound without erythema. There is serosanguinous discharge from the pancreatic suction drain. The lungs are clear to auscultation. A Foley catheter and right subclavian central venous access are present, both placed at the time of surgery. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's fever?
A 2-year-old child with delayed developmental milestones presents to the OPD. A T2 weighted MRI is performed, and the imaging result is shown. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is the likely diagnosis of the image shown below?

A 45-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with colicky pain in the right upper quadrant. Her pain started about an hour ago after a large, fatty meal and is associated with nausea. The patient had a similar episode a week ago that resolved spontaneously. The patient had a cholecystectomy 2 years ago due to symptomatic cholelithiasis. Her other medical problems include hyperlipidemia and obesity. Laboratory results are as follows: Leukocytes: 8,000/mm³ Total bilirubin: 1.3 mg/dL Alkaline phosphatase: 120 U/L Aspartate aminotransferase (SGOT): 37 U/L Alanine aminotransferase (SGPT): 49 U/L Amylase: 91 U/L Abdominal ultrasonography reveals a mildly dilated common bile duct but no stones. While in the emergency department, the patient receives morphine for pain control, but the pain worsens. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
All of the following are at an increased risk in the condition below except:

Following a major road accident, a 25-year-old male is stabilized in casualty. He is noticed to have abdominal bruising, for which a CECT abdomen is done. A zone 1 retroperitoneal hematoma is found. In suspected abdominal aortic injury, exposure is achieved via which manoeuvre?
Patellar Clunk Syndrome scar is present at superior pole of patella and impinging on:

A young woman presented to the OPD with dysphagia and regurgitation of food. She was diagnosed with iron deficiency anemia 3 months back. Barium swallow was done and is shown below. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 46-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to several episodes of vomiting. The last episode of emesis contained blood. Five hours ago, he had a fatty meal and several alcoholic drinks. The patient's medical history is notable for alcohol abuse. The ultrasound revealed an enlarged, hyperechoic liver and gallstones in the gallbladder, and the endoscopy found mild esophagitis and gastritis. His temperature is 36.6 C (97.9 F), blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, pulse is 95/min, and respirations are 15/min. Nasogastric suction returns normal stomach contents mixed with bright red blood. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this patient's bloody vomiting?

options.label: A
options.text: Effort related rupture of the esophagus

options.label: D
options.text: Mucosal tear at the gastrosophageal junction

questions.correct_answer: D. Mucosal tear at the gastrosophageal junction

questions.text: Identify the nerve supply of the marked muscle:

A patient with open wound with fracture of both bones of right lower limb came to the emergency. The doctor labelled the injury as 3B according to Gustilo- Anderson Classification. Which of the following would represent the injury?

options.label: A
options.text: Open wound with fracture with wound <1 cm

options.label: B
options.text: Open wound with fracture, 1 to 10 cm wound size, but mild soft tissue injury

options.label: C
options.text: Open wound > 10 cm, though soft tissue coverage not required

options.label: D
options.text: Open wound >10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage

questions.correct_answer: D. Open wound >10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Open wound >10 cm, with extensive injury requiring soft tissue coverage

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presents to the emergency department with acute onset shortness of breath following a motor vehicle accident. On examination, decreased breath sounds are noted on the left side. Bedside ultrasonography is performed, and the image shown is obtained using M-mode. Which of the following signs is most likely being depicted in this ultrasound image?

A 45-year-old man comes to the office with a 6-month history of recurrent, burning epigastric pain and diarrhea. His stools are greasy and unusually foul smelling. He has tried several over-the-counter medications, including antacids, H-2 blockers, and proton pump inhibitors, with moderate success. Vital signs are normal. Examination shows no abnormalities except for midepigastric tenderness to deep palpation. Test of the stool for occult blood is positive, and stool fat is also positive. Gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals two duodenal ulcers and a jejunal ulcer. Which of the following is the best explanation for this patient's impaired fat absorption?
Arrange the sequence of damage control surgery: 1. Hemorrhage control 2. Definitive repair 3. Abdomen closure 4. Resuscitation in ICU
What is the likely diagnosis in the image shown below?

A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to a stab wound to the chest. The patient was retuming to his parked car when he was mugged. He tried to resist, but the assailant stabbed him once in the left chest with a switchblade. During transport, the patient became unresponsive and required intubation. He also received 1L of normal saline. Upon arrival, blood pressure is 80/42 mm Hg and pulse is 132/min. Pulse oximetry is 98% on 60% oxygen. On physical examination, there is a fist-sized blood stain on the patient's shirt and a 3-cm linear wound in the left fifth intercostal space at the midaxillary line, with dried blood and no active external hemorrhage. Breath sounds are diminished in the left lung and normal in the right lung. Heart sounds are normal. The jugular veins are flat. Focused assessment with sonography for trauma (FAST) reveals left-sided intrathoracic free fluid. A left-sided chest tube is placed with immediate output of 2,000 mL of blood. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?
Match the following:

A 45-year-old male with carcinoma colon underwent USG of the abdomen that showed a hyperechoic lesion in the liver. MRI was performed as shown here. Identify the liver lesion shown on given T2W MRI sequence.
The following pelvic X-ray was seen in a patient. All the following signs will be present except:

A 52-year-old woman comes to the emergency department for rectal pain that started 2 hours ago. The pain is described as severe, burning, and exacerbated while sitting. Medical history is significant for chronic idiopathic constipation, for which she takes a fiber supplement. The patient has 4 children, all of whom were vaginally delivered. The abdomen is soft, nondistended, and nontender. Bowel sounds are normoactive. Anal examination reveals a small, exquisitely tender, bluish lesion at the anal verge. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Arrange the following external fixators used for treatment of fracture of tibia in order of increasing stability: I. Ilizarov II. Uniplanar frame with one rod III. Biplanar frame IV. Uniplanar frame with two rods

A 45-year-old woman presents with sudden onset dyspnea and left-sided chest pain. On physical examination, you note decreased breath sounds on the left side. Chest radiography is performed. Which of the following is least likely to cause an opaque left hemithorax on the radiograph of this patient?

A 23-year-old man was found unresponsive at the scene of a RTA and intubated by paramedics. He received 2.5 L of normal saline over 20 minutes en route to the emergency department. At the emergency department, blood pressure is 70/30 mm Hg and pulse is 120/min. The patient responds to strong vocal and tactile stimuli by opening his eyes. Pupils are equal and reactive to light. There are multiple bruises over the anterior chest and upper abdomen. Neck veins are flat, trachea is midline, and extremities are cold. The abdomen is mildly distended. Cardiac monitoring shows sinus tachycardia. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Diastolic collapse with elevated right ventricular pressure

options.label: B
options.text: Dilated left ventricle with apical hypokinesis

options.label: D
options.text: Small left ventricular cavity volume with ejection fraction of 75%

questions.correct_answer: D. Small left ventricular cavity volume with ejection fraction of 75%
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Small left ventricular cavity volume with ejection fraction of 75%

questions.text: What is the likely diagnosis?
According to the Strasberg’s classification of bile leaks, leak from an aberrant right posterior sectoral duct comes under?

A 67-year-old man comes to the OPD due to 2 days of back pain. He was moving boxes in his garage when the pain started. The pain is not relieved by lying down and increases in intensity when straining and coughing. He cannot sleep at night due to pain and has taken acetaminophen several times without relief. He has never had such pain before. Physical examination shows 2+ symmetrical knee and ankle jerk reflexes. Straight leg raising test is negative. There is point tenderness to palpation and percussion along the midline at the fourth lumbar vertebra. Which of the following is the most likely underlying etiology of this patient's current condition?
questions.correct_answer: D. Loss of bone mineral density

questions.text: A 40-year-old female presents with a history of recurrent epigastric pain radiating to the back and accompanied by nausea. She has had multiple hospital admissions due to these episodes. Her serum amylase and lipase are elevated during attacks. Imaging has shown no gallstones or common bile duct dilation. There is no history of alcohol abuse, and her recent attack did not have associated jaundice or evidence of cholangitis.Which of the following is least likely to be an indication for performing an Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangiopancreatography (ERCP) in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Pancreatitis without features choledochal cyst or cholangitis

questions.correct_answer: D. Pancreatitis without features choledochal cyst or cholangitis
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Pancreatitis without features choledochal cyst or cholangitis

questions.text: Steps of surgery of DDH in a child < 2 years: A. Capsulotomy B. Femoral osteotomy C. Identification of true acetabulum using round ligament D. Placing the head back into acetabulum
A woman has been diagnosed with endometrial carcinoma is undergoing radiotherapy. Choose the correct statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Intensity is directly proportional to the square of the distance from the source

options.label: B
options.text: Small blood vessels are most radioresistant

options.label: C
options.text: Rapidly proliferating cells are most radioresistant

questions.correct_answer: D. Bone marrow is most radiosensitive
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Bone marrow is most radiosensitive

questions.text: A 65-year-old man who underwent right total knee replacement 6 months ago comes to the emergency department due to a 3-week history of dull pain in his right knee. Examination shows mild swelling and tenderness at the knee with full range of motion. The skin over the joint is intact. The synovial fluid is sampled and results are as follows: Leukocytes 10,000/mm3 Neutrophils 80% Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?
Identify the artery marked by red arrow:

A 19-year-old college student who had a history of frequent respiratory infections as a child presents to the OPD. He has been experiencing recurrent episodes of coughing and shortness of breath over the past few months. He also complains of fatigue and chest pain, particularly on the left side. The CT scan reveals a mass in the lower lobe of his left lung as shown. What is the likely diagnosis?

Patient had difficulty in walking upstairs. When he was made to bear weight on right lower limb, the left-sided pelvis dropped down but when he was standing on the left lower limb, the right-sided pelvis moved up. Which of the following is the likely lesion?
questions.correct_answer: A. Right superior gluteal nerve palsy
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Right superior gluteal nerve palsy

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to 3 months of progressive right shoulder pain radiating to her forearm. The patient has a history of rheumatoid arthritis and takes methotrexate and naproxen, which have controlled her morning stiffness and joint tenderness. Physical examination shows mild drooping of the right upper eyelid and right pupillary constriction. Range of motion over the right shoulder is normal and does not elicit arm pain. There are bilateral hand joint deformities with no swelling and minimal tenderness. Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient?
In fasciotomy done for compartment syndrome, you incise:

options.label: C
options.text: Skin, superficial fascia subcutaneous fat and deep fascia

questions.correct_answer: C. Skin, superficial fascia subcutaneous fat and deep fascia
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Skin, superficial fascia subcutaneous fat and deep fascia

questions.text: Identify the finding on endoscopy in the image shown:

A 38-year-old woman comes to the emergency department for right flank pain radiating to the groin. She also has hematuria but no dysuria or urinary frequency. The patient has no costovertebral angle tenderness. Abdominal imaging shows a 6-mm calculus in the distal right ureter with no hydronephrosis. The patient's symptoms improve with intravenous hydration and analgesics. Which of the following medications will be most helpful in facilitating stone passage?
In a patient suspected of having autosomal recessive polycystic kidney disease (ARPKD), which of the following ultrasonographic findings would be least likely?

A 4-year-old child was playing at home. Suddenly his mother found him lying on the floor choking. She suspects he has ingested a foreign body and rushes him to the casualty. An X-ray is done which shows the following picture. What is the next line of management?

A 67-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to abdominal discomfort and distension. Five days ago, he began having large-volume watery stools 6-8 times daily after eating at a new restaurant. He self-treated with increased oral fluids and the stool frequency and consistency began to improve. However, his bowel movements abruptly stopped yesterday, and the diffuse abdominal discomfort and distension worsened. Medical history includes hypertension, coronary artery disease, and heart failure treated with diuretics. The abdomen is distended, tympanic, and mildly tender to palpation with no guarding or rebound tenderness. Bowel sounds are decreased. Digital rectal examination reveals an empty rectal vault with no evidence of blood or melena. Abdominal CT scan shows diffuse colonic dilation with nondilated small bowels. Which of the following most likely contributed to this patient's current condition?
When performing a replant of an amputated finger, which of the following is the correct order of surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: Bone, Artery, Extensor, Flexor, Nerve, Vein.

options.label: B
options.text: Artery, Bone, Vein, Extensor, Flexor, Nerve.

options.label: C
options.text: Artery, Bone, Extensor, Flexor, Vein, Nerve.

options.label: D
options.text: Bone, Extensor, Flexor, Artery, Nerve, Vein.

questions.correct_answer: D. Bone, Extensor, Flexor, Artery, Nerve, Vein.
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Bone, Extensor, Flexor, Artery, Nerve, Vein.

questions.text: On mammogram all of the following are the features of BIRADS-5 lesion except:

A 6-year-old child presents with recurrent episodes of abdominal pain and jaundice. Upon evaluation, an ultrasound of the abdomen was performed. Based on the image provided, which structure likely represents a choledochal cyst? Identify the choledochal cyst in the image below?

A 7-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department due to a right arm injury. While jumping on a trampoline, she slipped and fell onto her outstretched right hand. The patient had immediate pain and would not move her arm. She is holding the right arm in flexion and winces when it is moved. X-ray is shown below. Which of the following is at greatest risk of injury in this patient?
A 45-year-old female presents with something coming out per anus. Which of the following is not the perineal approach for this disease?
What is the angle of the canthomeatal line with the IR in the following view:
Following clubfoot surgery, which of the following is the commonest residual deformity?

A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD for evaluation of new-onset pain in the right knee. The patient first noticed the pain 3 weeks ago after a long hike in the mountains. The patient has Paget disease of bone, which was diagnosed 10 years ago, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. The right knee has diffuse soft tissue swelling and a small effusion with no surrounding erythema. X-ray of the right knee is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's knee pain?

options.label: B
options.text: Destruction and inflammation of articular cartilage

options.label: D
options.text: Malignant proliferation of osteoid sarcomatous stroma

questions.correct_answer: D. Malignant proliferation of osteoid sarcomatous stroma
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Malignant proliferation of osteoid sarcomatous stroma

questions.text: A 2-year-old girl was referred for evaluation of recurrent urinary tract infections. She suffered 4 episodes over the past 9 months and had been hospitalized twice. An ultrasound revealed bilateral hydronephrosis with dilatation of ureters. What is the investigation of choice in this child?
Whitaker test is performed for:

options.label: B
options.text: Hydronephrosis to compare abdominal and urinary bladder pressures

questions.correct_answer: B. Hydronephrosis to compare abdominal and urinary bladder pressures

questions.text: A 22-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a left scrotal mass that he first noticed a few months ago. The patient has scrotal heaviness and an increase in the size of the mass after prolonged standing at his job . His symptoms improve when lying down. Physical examination shows an irregular, soft mass in the left scrotum above and separate from the left testis. The mass increases in size during Valsalva maneuver and does not transilluminate. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
questions.correct_answer: B. Dilation of the pampiniform plexus

questions.text: A 24-year-old primigravida has come for an antenatal ultrasound examination. The sonographic image obtained is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old pregnant woman came to the OPD after she developed back pain radiating to the posterolateral aspect of the leg after lifting a heavy object at home. On examination, sensory loss was present over the anterolateral aspect of the leg, dorsum of the foot, and great toe. Medial Hamstring reflex was diminished with normal rest of the deep tendon reflexes. MRI picture is shown below. The most probable diagnosis is:
Match the following triage tags with the appropriate traumatic conditions Condition 1. Black 2. Red 3. Green 4. Yellow A. Flail chest B. Femur fracture C. Extensive polytrauma D. ACL avulsion

An 18-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after falling and striking his chest. He had been playing an interactive video game when he lost his balance and hit his left chest against the coffee table. The patient now has moderate left-sided chest pain, worse with deep inspiration. Blood pressure is 88/50 mm Hg, pulse is 122/min, and respirations are 28/min. Jugular veins are flat. The trachea is midline. The left chest wall has intact, bruised skin and is exquisitely tender to palpation. Breath sounds are present on the right but diminished in the left lung base, which is dull to percussion. Heart sounds are normal without murmurs. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
All of the following is true about brachytherapy except:

options.label: B
options.text: Better than teletherapy for Large & bulky tumor

options.label: C
options.text: Deliver higher dose of radiation to tumor

questions.correct_answer: B. Better than teletherapy for Large & bulky tumor

questions.text: Injury to which nerve can lead to the following appearance while making a fist?
What does the acronym SPECT stand for in medical imaging?
questions.correct_answer: A. Single Photon Emission Computed Tomography

questions.text: Diagnose the fracture shown in the given image:

A patient who sustained blunt abdominal trauma after a road accident is admitted to the ICU overnight. He is hemodynamically stable. On abdominal examination, he now has tenderness, rigidity, and rebound tenderness. Which is the next best step?

A 20-year-old man was stabbed in the chest during a street fight. Blood pressure is 90/58 mm Hg, pulse is 124/min, and respirations are 30/min. The patient is in severe respiratory distress. Breath sounds are present on the left and absent on the right. Heart sounds are normal. The neck veins are distended. The patient becomes obtunded during examination. Which of the following is the best next step in management?
A female patient presents with sore throat, difficulty in swallowing and sensation of lump in one side of mouth. The plain X-ray demonstrates the following image. What is the diagnosis?

A 45 year old lady presents with abdominal pain. USG reveals multiple gall stones with no wall thickening. CBD diameter is 12 mm and serum bilirubin is 0.8mg/dl. GGT is raised by 5 times. What is the next best step of management?

39-year-old woman who recently underwent thyroidectomy for Grave's disease complains of anxiety, muscle cramps, and poor sleep. Electrocardiogram shows normal sinus rhythm with prolongation of the corrected QT interval to 510 msec (normal <460 msec). Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

An elderly male patient presented with purulent discharge from an opening located in the perianal region. The patient is put in a lithotomy position and the opening is located at the 11 o'clock position, 4 cm from the anal margin. What will be the likely position of the internal opening and where does the internal opening start?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the breast clinic with a painless lump in her left breast that she discovered during a self-examination. On examination, a well-defined, mobile, firm, and non-tender mass of 2 cm is palpated in the upper outer quadrant of the left breast. The overlying skin is smooth, and there is no nipple discharge or lymphadenopathy. Mammogram is shown below. Classify the following mammography lesion as per BIRADS staging:
A 12-year-old boy came to the OPD with scald injury of arm. The lesion was pink, oozing, and painful to air and touch. Which of the following is the most appropriate management?
What is the appearance of CSF on T1 weight MRI-T2 weighted MRI -FLAIR respectively?

A 34-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to fullness in her neck. Examination reveals a 1.4-cm firm, nontender, mobile nodule in her left thyroid lobe. The remainder of the physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory evaluation shows low serum TSH of 0.25 pU/mL, high serum total thyroxine (T4) of 10 pg/dL, and high serum triiodothyronine (T3) of 176 ng/dL. A thyroid ultrasound reveals a 1.4-cm left thyroid nodule with smooth margins and no microcalcifications or internal vascularity. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

A 30-year-old actress who underwent Roux-en-Y gastric bypass surgery for obesity, presents with complaints of sweating, palpitations, epigastric fullness, and loose stools which start immediately after meals. Which of the following would you not associate with her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is precipitated by carbohydrate rich food.

options.label: B
options.text: It is more common after partial gastrectomy with the Billroth ll reconstruction.

options.label: D
options.text: It is relieved by lying down

questions.text: What is the most common area affected, in the given image, in case of tuberculosis of hip?

A 14-year-old male presents with a 4-week history of worsening left leg pain. The pain is constant, dull, and aching in nature. The patient denies any trauma or injury to the leg. On examination, there is tenderness over calf with swelling. There is no warmth or erythema. X-ray is shown. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 30-year-old woman comes to the office due to pain over the lateral side of the right wrist for the last 4 days. She is 6 weeks postpartum from her first child, and the pain is most severe when she lifts the infant from the crib. The patient has not had acute trauma to the wrist or hand. Vital signs are normal. Examination is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
Inferior thyroid artery supplies which of the following structures? Thyroid Parathyroid Esophagus Thymus

During periods of prolonged fasting, one of the following tissues preferentially uses fatty acids as energy-providing substrates. It is because this tissue has the highest concentration of lipoprotein lipase. Identify this tissue:
You notice the following finding on the transvaginal USG of a woman with amenorrhea. What is the earliest gestational age at which this can be detected?

A 28-year-old man comes to the OPD for evaluation of a left testicular mass. The mass has been present for 2 months and has increased in size. A painless, hard nodule is noted in the left testicle. There is no inguinal lymphadenopathy. Scrotal ultrasound reveals a solid, hypochoic 5-cm left testicular mass. What is the next best step in management of this patient?
Which of the following is not a true statement about CT?

options.label: B
options.text: The higher the pitch, the lower will be the CT quality

options.label: C
options.text: Helical CT is faster than non-helical CT

options.label: D
options.text: The higher the pitch, the higher will be the radiation dose

questions.correct_answer: D. The higher the pitch, the higher will be the radiation dose

questions.text: All are true about cephalosporins except:

options.label: A
options.text: Cefazolin is a first generation parenteral cephalosporin

options.label: C
options.text: Cefixime has poor activity against Staph aureus

options.label: D
options.text: Cefoxitin has no activity against anaerobes

questions.correct_answer: D. Cefoxitin has no activity against anaerobes

questions.text: What is the most likely diagnosis of the X-ray depicted below?

A 52-year-old man comes to the clinic for follow-up of a nonhealing wound on his right leg. Eight months ago, the patient had an open fracture of his right tibia due to a motorcycle accident. His injury was surgically treated, and for 2 weeks afterward he had occasional fevers that resolved with a course of antibiotics. For the past month, he has had clear drainage from the wound, which has required daily changing of the dressing. The patient has type 2 diabetes mellitus, which is treated with insulin, and hypertension. X-ray of the leg is shown. Which of the following is the best next step in the management of this patient's condition?

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate surgical fixation of the tibia

questions.correct_answer: D. Surgical debridement and bone biopsy
questions.explanation: Ans. D Surgical debridement and bone biopsy

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman was diagnosed with breast cancer three years ago. She underwent a lumpectomy followed by chemotherapy and radiation therapy. She was then started on hormone therapy for five years. Her initial tumor was estrogen receptor-positive, progesterone receptor-positive, and HER2-negative. During her recent follow-up appointment, she complained of increasing bone pain in her right hip and lower back. The oncologist orders a bone scan to assess for bony metastases. The radioactive isotope of which of the following is used?

10-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to postprandial abdominal pain and bilious emesis. Two days ago, the patient stopped his bicycle abruptly and slammed into the handlebar. He immediately experienced abdominal pain, which improved over the next several hours. Physical examination shows epigastric tenderness without rigidity or rebound tenderness. Bowel sounds are normal. Bedside ultrasonography reveals no intraperitoneal free fluid. Plain abdominal radiograph shows gastric dilation with scant distal gas. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The given image shows:

A 3-day-old newborn baby boy is brought to the hospital with difficulty breathing, cyanosis and coughing whenever he is fed. The baby was born full-term via vaginal delivery, and his mother had an uneventful pregnancy. He had a birth weight of 2.8 kg and was discharged from the hospital after 48 hours of observation. On examination, the baby appears to be in respiratory distress, with increased work of breathing and decreased oxygen saturation levels. What would be the best contrast of choice for study?
Choose the incorrect statement regarding the given image:

options.label: C
options.text: There is no restriction of movement

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to increasing episodes of nausea and substernal discomfort over the past several months. The episodes frequently occur after eating. Chest imaging is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely underlying cause of this patient's current symptoms?

options.label: C
options.text: Gastric herniation into the thoracic cavity

options.label: D
options.text: Laxity of the lower esophageal sphincter

questions.correct_answer: C. Gastric herniation into the thoracic cavity
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Gastric herniation into the thoracic cavity
